subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Norse Mythology: Gods Who Knew They Would Die
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Norse Mythology: Gods Who Knew They Would Die.

hook.text: In Norse myth, even the gods die. Ragnarok ends everything: gods, humans, the universe. Then it starts again.

buildup.text: Odin, Thor, and Loki are the most famous Norse gods. They live in Asgard, connected to Earth by a rainbow bridge.

discovery.text: Norse religion was fatalistic. The gods fight a losing battle against chaos. Courage matters more than victory.

twist.text: Vikings didn't fear death because Valhalla awaited warriors. Dying in battle was a promotion, not a punishment.

climax.text: Norse mythology inspires Marvel, Tolkien, and metal music. Ancient gods found new life in modern pop culture.

punchline.text: Even Norse gods die. Their courage, not their victory, was the lesson.

quiz.question: What is Ragnarok?
options: The prophesied destruction of gods and the world
